body.name: Dream On Me 2-in-1 Lightweight Folding Portable Stationary Side Crib in Pebble Grey, Greenguard Gold Certified, Baby Crib to Playpen, Folds Flat for Storage, Locking Wheels

byLineInfo.name: Visit the Dream On Me Store

deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tomorrow, February 15. Order within 3 hrs 8 mins
features: DUAL USE: This crib delights with its functionality . The crib assembly is quick and the U.S. patented rail design easily helps convert it from a crib to a playpen in seconds, making it a nursery must-have .

COMPACT and PORTABLE: The unique hinge system allows it to fold flat for compact storage. It’s lightweight frame with wheels allow easy maneuverability and portability, making it the ideal travel companion. Product weight is 32 lbs
SAFETY MATTERS: The stationary (non drop side) rail system and dual hooded, locking wheels provide the utmost in product safety. It meets applicable ASTM/CPSC standards

NEAT DESIGN: Made of pinewood, it’s lean, minimalist design and six stylish finish options give it a versatile appeal, allowing it to mix and match into any room decor. One inch crib mattress and tools for easy assembly included
PRODUCT SPECS: Crib dimensions are 40L x 26W x 38H. Maximum baby weight limit is 35 lbs
body.description: The Dream On Me 2 in 1 Lightweight Folding Portable Stationary Side Crib, with its modern aesthetic and features, is a nursery must-have for today’s parents. Crib assembly is quick and the U.S. patented rail design allows you to easily convert the crib to a playpen in seconds The unique hinge system allows you to fold the crib flat, with just one hand, for compact storage. It’s lightweight, portable frame with wheels makes it easy for you to move it around the house. Take it on your travels or to grandma’s house! Safety is a top priority at Dream On Me. The stationary (non drop side) rail system and dual hooded, locking wheels provide the utmost in product safety. It meets the applicable ASTM/CPSC standards. Made of pinewood, it’s lean, minimalist design and non-toxic stylish finish options give it a versatile appeal, allowing it to mix and match into any room decor. One inch crib mattress and tools for easy assembly included. Crib dimensions are 40L x 26W x 38H. One inch crib mattress and tools for easy assembly included. Maximum baby weight limit is 35 lbs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for small spaces
reviews.reviewText: My sister love this portable crib it’s perfect for small spaces apartment. I do recommend in buying another mattress do to the reason that the mattress it comes with is very thin.other than that it’s very beautiful

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I give this mini crib a 5 star review I absolutely love it for my 6 month old. He grew out of his bassinet and I switched to this, it was easy to assemble (the instructions are conveniently printed on the base board) and the best part about it is the way it folds for storage if you aren't using it! It has wheels so it moves around easily. I don't have anything bad to say about the crib itself. However I do recommend buying a separate mattress because the pad it comes with is very thin.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wish we went with this instead of bassinet
reviews.reviewText: We had a baby in July 2022 and had him sleeping in our room in a bassinet. While it was a nice bassinet and worked great, the weight limit was 15 lbs. Apparently that is the weight limit for most bassinets! My little guy outgrew the bassinet by like 3 months, and we weren't ready to move him to the crib in his own room just yet. We attempted to move the big crib from the nursery into our bedroom but it was just way too big. We ended up buying this portable mini crib and it worked for our space so well. I wish we had just used this from the get go instead of buying the bassinet! It went together quick, rolled easily on our carpet floors, and fit a mini crib mattress perfectly. The mobile we had fit on the side of the crib nicely. We used that crib until he was ready to move into his own room, then gave it to my parents for when they watch him. 100% recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars It's ok - quality control issues
reviews.reviewText: Overall the crib is fine, however assembly was a challenge, locks did not align with the holes, the base platform plastic piece appeared to be on the wrong side of the base or they intend for your baby's mattress to rest on top of two metal locks, doesn't appear correct. The instructions are mounted onto the base, so it is tricky to follow each step mid way through assembly. And if you screw in the lock to a point that the screws are flush, the lock is too tight - so they have to remain raised a bit. Overall, quality control could use some improvement. It functions, but could be improved.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Crib materials, bent, destroyed, poor quality throughout
reviews.reviewText: Don't waste your money! It's taken over two weeks to attempt to put this "crib" together due to sections of the crib metals being so bent that they require a vise to correct the bent metal, cheap aluminum screws that strip so we had to replace them with stronger screws. The "mattress" that is included is no thicker than a piece of cardboard and less comfortable. What a waste of money, time, effort! Shame on you for selling this crap.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Don’t believe the bad reviews. Oh & buy a separate mattress
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. First let me start by saying, don’t be scared by other reviews.We were a little afraid based on reviews stating how difficult it was to build, it wasn’t.My hubby built this by himself in less than an hour. MAYBE 45 minutes if that.I didn’t help, being on bed rest I just watched.It was annoying that the instructions were on the board itself(that lays down and is the shelf for the mattress) but it was still doable since that’s the last thing that goes in anyway.My hubby is an electrician and not so great at building things by himself sometimes and he did great.Some things I did want to point out:-Be careful! The paint can chip/scuff easily, we made a scuff or two but nowhere really visible.-Don’t completely open the package of screws/parts and just open and take as you go. They’re all labeled on the packaging and if you just open it up and pour it all out you won’t know which is which.-BUY A SEPARATE MATTRESS! I can’t stress this enough, the “mattress” it comes with is a total insult lol, luckily I read about it beforehand and had bought a mattress from the same company. The mattress in the crib in the picture is NOT the one it comes with. There’s a separate picture showing the one it comes with, which is basically a piece of foam with plastic covering. I’ll be using it as added cushion in my pack and play.My review is solely based on the crib and assembly, not the mattress so that’s why it didn’t effect the rating. I’m not used to cribs coming with mattresses anyway so it’s not that serious.It’s perfect for us since we’re room sharing with baby and it’s just small enough to be convenient but big enough for necessity.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Save your money !
reviews.reviewText: ONE STAR REVIEW !! Do not buy safety hazard !

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars extremely lightweight - beware with babies who can stand
reviews.reviewText: the base (the part which holds the mattress) fell right through after one night - thankfully it only fell on one side while my baby was sleeping, and the other side didn't go through until i picked him up - otherwise he would have fallen straight through to the floor. when i went on amazon to report that it was defective, i realized from the picture that we are missing the little rectangular supports that screw in underneath the base - so, maybe our unit was missing them, or maybe they got lost when we threw away the packaging, i have no way of knowing - but when you assemble the crib, please make sure you have them, otherwise it is a serious danger to your baby - the metal latches that hold the base slip out, and definitely are not enough to hold it in place!! i initially bought this for my older baby (18 months) but i saw right away that because it was so lightweight, the whole thing would be easy for him to move (even with the wheels locked) and possibly tip over when he wakes up and shakes the railing wanting to get out. so we used it for my 5 month old instead (and now will be putting out with the trash, since without those little supports, the base is unstable). in any case, the product lists a 35 lb weight limit (beyond which maybe it could collapse?), but our son is only 25 lbs and the issue probably isn't weight, but whether the kid can stand and shake the crib. in my opinion, this product should not be used for an older baby who can stand; it's just too flimsy.
